description: Installation of sixteen single storey refurbished shipping containers for use as a Development of Circular Economy Hub (Renew, repair, recycle centre) on existing hardstanding
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| Within 12 months of the occupation of the premises, details shall be submitted to Council on the measures to soften the appearance of the metal structures and perimeter fence through artwork and paintwork, and any opportunities for landscaping along the front of the site. Approved details shall be implemented within 12 months of the date of the approval.

Reason: To ensure that the propsoed development integrates well with its surroundings and to improve the visual amenity of the site, in accordance with Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD, Policy DAA of the Draft Ealing Local Plan, Policy D4 of the London Plan and the South Acton LSIS Masterplan

| Cycle storage for ^IN;  bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development, within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with the designated locations identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and all adopted standards prior to the first occupation of the building. The storage spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason:  To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021).
